# Create C# REST API for Todo Items

Create a C# REST API with the following requirements:

## Data Model
- **Todo Item** with properties:
  - `Id` (int, unique identifier, auto-incremented by the service)
  - `Description` (string)
  - `Status` (enum: Pending, Active, Complete)

## Storage
- In-memory storage
- Initialize with 3 default todo items on startup

## Endpoints
1. **GET /api/todos** - Get all todo items
2. **GET /api/todos/{id}** - Get a single todo item by ID
3. **POST /api/todos** - Add a new todo item (ID auto-generated by service)
4. **PUT /api/todos/{id}** - Update an existing todo item

## Technical Requirements
- Use ASP.NET Core Web API
- Follow REST conventions
- Include appropriate HTTP status codes (200, 201, 404, etc.)
- Use dependency injection for the in-memory repository
- Include basic validation

## Implementation Details
- Use a repository pattern or service class to manage the in-memory collection
- Auto-increment integer for unique IDs (start from 1)
- Return appropriate responses for not found scenarios
